definitions.definition: A person who is trained to preach, to perform religious ceremonies, and to afford pastoral care at a Protestant church .
examples: The minister said a prayer on behalf of the entire congregation .

definitions.definition: A person (either a layperson or an ordained clergy member) who is commissioned to perform some act on behalf of the Catholic Church .
A politician who heads a ministry
examples: He was newly appointed to be Minister of the Interior.

definitions.definition: In diplomacy , the rank of diplomat directly below ambassador .
A servant ; a subordinate ; an officer or assistant of inferior rank ; hence, an agent , an instrument .

main_definition: ( Protestantism ) A person who is trained to preach, to perform religious ceremonies, and to afford pastoral care at a Protestant church .
secondary_definitions: ( Roman Catholicism ) A person (either a layperson or an ordained clergy member) who is commissioned to perform some act on behalf of the Catholic Church .
( government ) A politician who heads a ministry
In diplomacy , the rank of diplomat directly below ambassador .
A servant ; a subordinate ; an officer or assistant of inferior rank ; hence, an agent , an instrument .
